intro: Avenula lodunensis subsp. cintrana, commonly known as the slender grass vetch, is a flowering plant species native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by narrow, elongated pods. It is typically found in grassland habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in botanical research.
